question: Peter! Peter! Wait up! Would you, uh... excuse us for a minute?
answer: What is it? what...

question: Did the Astro-Physics Journal really accept your paper?
answer: Yeah... well... all I got's the data but they've agreed to publish it when it's finished. You know... it's my calculation on the Planetary Conjunction.

question: And its influence on the anti-force. Isn't it?
answer: Yes. Look, Harry, I am busy with...

question: Well, do you mean nothing... or do you mean something but you won't tell me what it is?
answer: I mean plain nothing.

question: Well, I guess that's about as nothing as you can get... plain nothing. A beat.
answer: Liz...!

question: Ahh, it is something.
answer: No... look.

question: I don't believe it, I simply don't...
answer: Can we carry on Mr. Thorkel.

question: I don't believe... oh, all right carry on Professor.
answer: Well! This week my dear students I have made a stunning breakthrough...

question: Wait a minute, wait a minute... you've got fire forms to fill out, Dr. Octavius.
answer: I have no time for forms, or administrators who persist in interrupting me, Mr. Thorkel. I now believe its possible that these counter forces can be... collected... the way the magnifying glass collects the sunlight... and focused into a hard beam I call... Weiner! I call it, the Anti-Force! This anti-force, once harnessed, is capable of undoing any natural force at which it is aimed... for instance... Gravity!

question: Look, it's just... I don't know... when you and Flash go after each other like that...
answer: He's not my type.

question: He doesn't have to be.
answer: Check.

question: And besides, he's not all bad.
answer: You don't get nicknamed Flash because you're a rocket scientist, Liz.

question: Give it up, Parker. You'd die for a nickname like Flash.
answer: Yeah, of embarrassment.

question: Hey, Flash... I'm scalping a pair of the Midnight Madness Wrestling Match tomorrow night.
answer: The Slammies??? I'd kill for that!!!

question: Would you pay $125?
answer: Well, uh, I... gee... if... can I tell you tomorrow?

question: Peter, Doc Ock wants to see you.
answer: About my data I bet.

question: I don't know.
answer: He knows about my work on the Planetary Conjunction, doesn't he?

question: I don't know.
answer: Hello, Professor Octavius. I really admired your experiment.

question: Hello, Professor Octavius. I really admired your experiment.
answer: We have a lot of interests in common, Peter. Perhaps we should put our heads together, if you know what I mean...

question: That would be... great.
answer: Now you take the Planetary Conjunction. This Saturday night we will witness Saturn, Jupiter, the Moon, the Earth, the Sun... all in a row. Never seen within the memory of man, or measured for its effect. The total gravitational force must be quite exceptional. Isn't that the subject of your paper...?

question: Yes sir, I've worked out a new way to calculate the combined gravitational effect.
answer: I'm a busy man, Mr. Parker. But I think I could find the time to go over it with you. Make sure it all... checks out.

question: Well... I'm sort of working with Professor Rosomorf and he suggested we kind of keep it between us. He thinks that my theory is... well, I don't know...
answer: The scoundrel... I want to see that data, Peter!

question: But Professor Octavius... if I knew you were interested... sorry, I've already given it to... Professor Rosomorf, and he is after all the head of our Physics Department... and I couldn't...
answer: Well, I'm certain something can be worked out. Run along, young man. Just a minute... how about if I show you my discoveries... something I never showed to any other student... as a matter of fact to anybody at all.

question: Well I am really flattered, I mean I'd love to... but I...
answer: Very well shall we say if you come here tonight...

question: But Professor I don't now if I should...
answer: Make it eight sharp... I'll be waiting for you... Right here... The same academic world that's so keen to embrace that boy's undergraduate work, ridicules my anti-force theory as quackery. I ask you, Weiner... what is our society coming to? Ha!

question: Make it eight sharp... I'll be waiting for you... Right here... The same academic world that's so keen to embrace that boy's undergraduate work, ridicules my anti-force theory as quackery. I ask you, Weiner... what is our society coming to? Ha!
answer: They are all a bunch of brainless assholes, that's what I say...

question: Weiner! Go get me that boy's data!
answer: Cost you fifty bucks.

question: Garbage! Absolute, 100% garbage! Bag ladies. I hate bag ladies.
answer: Yes, sir.

question: Little kids... I hate little kids. This is a daily newspaper. We need news value photographs, not artsy-fartsy shit!
answer: Yes, sir.

question: Kid? You want a pro's assessment?
answer: Yes, sir!

question: Your photos suck. Parker, my readers are morons. I gotta grab them by the eyes. Every time you press the button of that Nikon of yours it costs you fifty-five cents. So the next time you're about to take the plunge, ask yourself, am I taking dog bites man? Because if you are...
answer: I know, I know. You want man bites dog...

question: Parker, this is the post modern 20th century. I want man eats dog! Get out!
answer: Rent! Rent, more bills, rent... electricity, bills... There's nothing in there worth stealing!

question: Rent! Rent, more bills, rent... electricity, bills... There's nothing in there worth stealing!
answer: That's the understatement of the year.

question: Aunt May, you're trespassing.
answer: I was just so desperately bored... I thought I'd come over and make you dinner...

question: I am old enough to... to make my own--
answer: But I didn't feel like getting to know your roaches.

question: I'll introduce you.
answer: Oh. And those foul chemicals in the pots...

question: I take pictures, remember?
answer: Anyway, I've decided to kidnap you for dinner in Forest Hills...

question: It's Friday night...
answer: Yes. Do you have a date?

question: No.
answer: Then come on.

question: Professor Rosomorf, what happened here?
answer: Someone tried to rob me of some paper... I suspect they were looking for that one.

question: What is it?
answer: Award winning stuff. Peter Parker's data on the Planetary Conjunction. Damn lucky I hid it in my computer under another title.

question: My God, what's going on in our school? First Professor Octavius almost blows up the Physics lab... Now this. You report it in triplicate, of course.
answer: Thorkel, be careful when you talk to Octavius. Remember... the man is a very fragile genius. One day he'll bring us all the Noble Prize.

question: Rosomorf, the man is a very dangerous crackpot!
answer: That's him again. He's working day and night.

question: I tell you the man is very dangerous. Come on Rosomorf, let's stop him before this building will explode. Shut it down, Octavius. You've blown half the circuits in the Science Center.
answer: Call an electrician.

question: I have called the locksmith.
answer: What... what is he doing.

question: Another brewski?
answer: No, I'm fine, Uncle Ben.

question: Yah! Way to do it. Alright! You don't follow the Mets like you used to, do you, Pete?
answer: No, not so much anymore.

question: Funny. When your Mom and Dad, uh, passed away... I had this idea... I wanted you to be the best baseball player that ever was. Geez, what ever happened to that?
answer: Little league.

question: It's on the table! Turn off the TV! How's that girl you told us about, Peter?
answer: Liz? She's great... But she has a boyfriend.

question: A boy your age should have a girlfriend.
answer: Aunt May... she has a steady boyfriend.

question: Look, just leave him alone, okay. When he's ready for girls he'll be a holy terror. It's in the blood. Lookit, how are you fixed for money, Pete? Maybe I can help you out a little.
answer: No, I'm alright. My scholarship covers almost everything, and I sell some photos here and there. Today my physics professor asked for some of my work... he wants to study my data. They might publish my work in the science magazine... that'll bring me some money...

question: Publish your work?! You hear that May...?
answer: Yeah, in fact I have to leave a little early tonight, to meet Professor Octavius... He offered me to be his assistant...

question: No thank you, I just had dinner at my aunt's...
answer: Piss off, Weiner! Okey, dokey, Parker... how would you like to take Weiner's place... I mean, be my assistant?

question: Well, Professor, that would be a great honor, but I'm already working with...
answer: Rosomorf... that imbecile. Don't you understand, kid, that I am about to uncover the greatest discovery since Einstein came up with his theory of relativity... The "Anti-Force."

question: Wow! The theory of the Anti-force! You should go for the Noble Prize Professor...
answer: Noble Shmoble, I am going for a much bigger prize kid. Okey, dokey. Let me show you, kid, what I got here. Present maximum anti-force power to date is 38 percent of theoretical limit. I have patched in the variable particle-wave accelerator... I will now try to reach 50% power... And if your paper has any value... I can use it to get the power I'm missing to create the anti-force, to break through and beat any other form of power in our or any other universe, capish!

question: Sorry, Professor, I can't do it. I gave my word to Professor Rosomorf.
answer: 50 percent... anti-force... 50 percent... that's all I'm missing! Parker, we can be rich together!

question: Sorry... I'd better go now.
answer: You'll be sorry, Parker. You! Get out of there, you creeping... Noooooooooooo! It's an energy storm! Okey! Dokey!

question: There is no danger. Please go back to your dorms. I repeat, there is no danger.
answer: Spill it out, Professor! The public wants to know!

question: Who are you?
answer: Jameson, Daily Bugle, Chief Editor, now what really happened here?

question: Hey Parker! Peter Parker!
answer: Mr. Jameson! What are you doing here? What's going on?

question: That's for them to know, and for you to find out.
answer: But sir, they wouldn't tell us. You heard Thorkel... he said...

question: A press announcement tomorrow...! But we must know tonight Parker. This is your university, right...
answer: Yes, but...

question: You got your camera?
answer: Sure, but I can't--

question: A hundred dollars says you can?
answer: Yes sir!

question: Get inside and get pictures, fifty bucks.
answer: You just said a hundred.

question: Seventy, but I want blood and gore.
answer: Seeya guys.

question: Take it easy. Take it easy with him.
answer: Take him away and never bring him back! What was that?

question: What was what?
answer: What hit me?

question: What hit you?
answer: I don't know. It was so fast.

question: Ow!!! I feel a little funny... Right. Police lines.
answer: Okay, scoop, whaddaya got?

question: I... got pictures of the Professor... in there... it's so strange in there... so bizarre...
answer: Good job, kid. Bizarre is what we need. Pick this up in the morning. There'll be two crisp twenties tucked inside.

question: This is weird. My God, I feel so weird... Very weird. Very, very weird. Well, what the hell!!
answer: You're a kid who's going places, and I'm gonna point you the right way.

question: Max Reiss, models, strip dancers, escort girls, blue movies...
answer: Oops... sorry, wrong card.

question: Max Reiss, Talent management.
answer: It's a big outfit. Got a lot of departments.

question: Yeah... well... why you approach me? I'm not...
answer: Oh yes you are... very talented. The three questions of show business success. One do you think you possess a unique talent?

question: Well...
answer: Two... what are you gonna do with it?

question: Well... I don't know.
answer: Three... how much money you got in your pocket?

question: Ten.
answer: You invest half of that with me and I'll make you a star.

question: What are you talking about?
answer: I'm talking about fame. I'm talking about fortune. I'm talking about the chance of a lifetime. How'd you like to be on MTV tomorrow night?

question: MTV...? Me? Really?
answer: Taxi!

question: Hey!
answer: Kid! Tomorrow night. Same place, same time.

question: How do you know I'll show up?
answer: Because you wanna be a star... everybody does.

question: Hello? Aunt May?
answer: Peter? What time is it? Are you alright?

question: Well, no, I mean yeah I'm fine, but listen... Aunti, the craziest thing happened to me tonight.
answer: Does this have to do with a certain girl we talked about at dinner?

question: No, no, look, there was this radioactive experiment... I was poisoned!
answer: You were what?

question: I was bitten by a bug.
answer: Oh! I get it, you mean a love bug.

question: No... No... A spider...
answer: Peter, did you at least talk to her?

question: Aunt May, listen to me. I got bitten on the hand... by a poisonous spider.
answer: She bit you?

question: No. I was in the bathroom and...
answer: Oh, you did it in the bathroom? Peter, this is craziness, why don't you use your bed? You're up all night. You're in the radioactive labs. You never take time to eat or sleep. Am I right?

question: Yes, Aunt May.
answer: Did you eat something today?

question: Yes, Aunt May.
answer: Okay, Peter go back to bed, and remember we love you.

question: Look at these brainwave readings. The mental activity is ten times of any normal man...! Hell, yeah... his. My God... I thought I'd seen everything...
answer: It is so freaky...

question: Okay, lets stop yakking and get cracking. I want to go in at the upper thoracic. Then we'll work our way around. Hang in there, man. Nurse! Number seven scalpel. Arthroscope stand by. Read out parameters in progress. Let's go in. You alright?
answer: Yes... Yes, of course. Everything's online.

question: Scalpel! No... no... a larger one... the largest we have! Mop. Mop! Sutures and clamps! Hurry up! Zap him!
answer: You have a visitor, Doctor...

question: Octavius, I'm afraid I have bad news for you.
answer: The cyclotron is damaged...

question: What used to be the cyclotron was permanently shut down this afternoon.
answer: But my work!

question: Your work is a disaster! Look at yourself!
answer: Myself? I don't matter. Nobody matters anymore. To enter a new dimension we must first destroy our own...

question: What are you saying?
answer: Destroy life. Life is... insignificant. Bags of sleepy, sluggish flesh. What would you say?

question: Oh, my God, what are those horrible things sticking from your body?
answer: Thorkel, if I told you that for one moment in time I broke all the laws! For one brief glorious moment, I broke through to the other side. I saw... I felt... I became creation.

question: What on Earth are you rambling about?
answer: Destiny!!! My destiny! I see it all so clearly now. Universal destruction, yes. All I need is the power... then I can destroy this illusion you call life. It is my destiny to lead us to the light!

question: You're a madman.
answer: And you are a fool. I will end the universe as you know it. And in that final moment... I'll laugh my ass off while you're kissing yours goodbye!

question: Goodbye is right, Octavius... You're fired... sacked... canned. You are history, Doctor Octavius. And I couldn't be more pleased to be the first to tell you this good news... Let me down Ock... you crazy... MONSTER! Let me down!
answer: Okey, dokey.

question: MTV Wrestling?!
answer: That's the place. Pay the man.

question: Look, Mr. Reiss... I'm not real interested in watching a wrestling match.
answer: Who said anything about watching a wrestling match? You're here to win a wrestling match!

question: Me? You must be kidding.
answer: You hop around. You know, the way you did last night. Your opponent gets tired. He falls down. The ref counts to three, you win, and we pick up a thousand bucks. You're really gonna love this.

question: Look, really, I don't know...
answer: You don't have to know. I know enough for both of us. Change in there.

question: What is this?
answer: A costume... something that fits your talent. Go put it on. I'm sure you'll like it.

question: How does it look? I feel like it's Halloween.
answer: Cover your face with the mask.

question: Why?
answer: Mystery, my friend. Nobody should know who you are... No, not Superman... Spider-Man... SPIDER-MAN!!!

question: What a wreck. What a useless, wasted wreck. Okey, dokey. We rebuild you, my damaged darling. Bigger, better, hotter! A world class, super cyclotron!
answer: There you are, doc... where have you been... whoa this place is messed up. Whoa, doc! You look a little messed up yourself.

question: Where have you been, you imbecile?
answer: I went to the wrestling...

question: Wrestling...
answer: I went after the kid. You still want that Parker guy's data, don't you?

question: Well, did you get it?
answer: No, I followed him... but I lost him in the crowd.

question: Lost him? You--
answer: I'll find him, Maestro... I promise... soon... maybe by tomorrow.

question: So how was the wrestling?
answer: Fantastic! There was this new wrestler... beat the mighty Crusher. You won't believe it... a nothing of a guy... calls himself this stupid name... the Amazing Spider-Man... would you believe it?

question: Spider-Man, huh? Well, maybe I'll just go and wrestle myself one of these days... with all my new arms... I'm sure I can beat Crusher or any other monster. Will I beat him, this Crusher, will I beat him or not?
answer: No... no, please... I mean yes, yes... you'll beat him easily... let me down... Please... I'll do anything for you...

question: And one like this... And one looking real sincere. What are you doing here?
answer: I'm looking for Peter Parker.

question: Oh, yes... so why not use the front door?
answer: Hey, I know you...

question: You do?
answer: I saw you crushing the Crusher.

question: You like wrestling?
answer: I love it! You are the best wrestler I have ever seen... please don't hurt me! Oh, please... don't kill me. Please help me down.

question: Of course I'll help you down. I am Spider-Man... the good guy, am I not?
answer: Yes... yes, you are.

question: Doesn't he look amazing in that one? Look, he's flying in the air!
answer: I don't care if he flies to the moon. He's just another wrestler in a silly costume. Look at this, Parker, right off the wire. This is the guy who hit that armored truck this morning. They say he has metal arms... get me a picture of this character!

question: Metal arms?
answer: Four of them.

question: Ock...?!
answer: The web faced weirdo... He is a joke in a Halloween costume... don't make me laugh. Now get out of here and don't come back without something I can use!

question: Yes sir...
answer: A mega baloney... A bug in blue tights... what next?

question: What do you think you're doing?
answer: I'm going to the Masquerade. It's Halloween tonight Doc, aren't you coming to the School Ball? Whoa, you could go without an outfit.

question: You're not going to any ball, clown. You're going to get me Peter Parker's data...
answer: I was almost killed on my last try... Look at all these bruises...

question: I don't care if you come back dead. Just get it!
answer: Cost you a thousand bucks, if I get it. All right... boss please let go...

question: I'm not...
answer: Holy jumping jelly beans, willya look at these pictures of Spider-Man? Wow! Is this guy great or what?

question: Hey, Peter! These are your pictures!
answer: Can't be...

question: It says here "Photos by Peter Parker."
answer: You know this guy, Parker?

question: Hey! Can't you go any faster?
answer: What'm I in, a race?

question: I don't know... I get this tingling in my brain, like some danger is lurking just ahead. I'm worried about Aunt May and Uncle Ben...
answer: Your family?

question: Well, they are kind of my parents. They raised me. I lost both of my parents in a car accident... please step on it!
answer: Step on it... so now you want to kill yourself in another accident... not with me, Boychick.

question: But I'm telling you... I've got this--
answer: ... tingling... I know. And I got ulcers... Everybody's got something to worry about.

question: Please... Faster... Please.
answer: Okay, you asked for it.

question: What were you doing in here?
answer: Cleaning up. Come on. I'll get your computer. Where's Flash parked?

question: Flash didn't come.
answer: Oh. Well... how are you going to get it home?

question: Taxi... I guess. You must spend a lot of time with this Spider-Man guy... Peter! Don't you think you ought to unplug that!
answer: I, uh, I'll go down to the corner... see it I can hail that taxi.

question: Peter...? Doctor Octavius...! You're... You're... You're so weird!... with those... what do you call those...
answer: Waldos... Did you hear about Spider-Man? That's me... the real Spider-Man... now tell me, where is that jerky friend of yours... Parker?

question: Peter?... oh... he's not here. He's gone. I don't think he'll be back for awhile.
answer: You wouldn't lie to your Professor now, would you?

question: Of course not. Why would I lie about a thing like that? Really. He's... out.
answer: We'll wait. OCK grabs LIZ'S HAIR with his WALDOS.

question: What are you doing... let me go! Please... take those things out of my hair!
answer: My Waldos, you mean.

question: Whatever you call them... please...
answer: Sit. He's a nice boy. A little nerdy maybe, but nice, wouldn't you say?

question: Oh, I don't know. Maybe. He's very inexperienced.
answer: You know, you're a fascinating young lady...

question: Thank you...
answer: You're so refreshing. You're so...

question: Shocking...?
answer: Oh, I wouldn't say shocking...

question: Now I must kill you, you cretinous clown. Once I dispose of you, Spider-Man, no one will be able to stop me.
answer: Stop you from what...?

question: My destiny!
answer: Over here, Octopus!

question: That's Professor Octopus to you Spider Jerk!
answer: Give it up, Professor. You'll never catch me! So long, sucker.

question: Wait a minute. Where are you taking me? SPIDEY hounded by the Police, rejected by the girl.
answer: I better just take you back where you belong. Hold on tight.

question: Where are we?
answer: Open your eyes.

question: If you're trying to impress me Spidey, I want you to know I'm not easy. Okay, I'm impressed... now put me down, Spidey... put me down.
answer: I like the way you say Spidey... Nobody calls me Spidey... now we go...

question: Wow... look, this is our dormitory. I can get to my room. Hey, wait a minute... there's Flash, if I'm not mistaken.
answer: Liz?

question: You know my name?
answer: Liz, listen to me. There's something I have to tell you.

question: Okay, put me down and we can talk, alright?
answer: Do you know who I am?

question: All I know is you're the Amazing Spider-Man... or better you're Spidey the good guy on the block... you're a weirdo in a clown spider suit.
answer: And that's all you know about me? Okay, lets get your boyfriend.

question: Which one?
answer: How many do you have? I meant Flash.

question: Well, Flash is not exactly my boyfriend...
answer: He's not? Then who is?

question: There's someone I like, but he's too shy to notice.
answer: Flash!

question: Hey, they won't let up, man! They keep calling you an accomplice in that burglary murder. But that's a crock, ain't it? I'm with you, Spidey, 100%
answer: Thanks.

question: By the way, what are you doing with... Liz?
answer: She needed a lift.

question: Oh... okay! This calls for a beer! A lot of beer!
answer: Thanks, but I have some business to take care of.

question: Peter...!
answer: Hi... have you seen Harry?

question: No. What a night, huh?
answer: Yeah, that was some ride home... must have been pretty exciting.

question: It was... okay. Look, I got two tickets to Les Miserables... wanna go?
answer: Sorry... I'm really busy... I mean, not tonight... see you later.

question: Hey, Peter... how did you know about last night...?
answer: What about last night?

question: My exciting ride with Spider-Man...
answer: Oh... Sorry... I gotta hurry... I have to find Harry... I'll see you later.

question: Peter!
answer: Hey! Can I get a lift downtown?

question: I gotta remember to have that fixed. There you are, I've been looking for you all over town.
answer: What happened?

question: Where were you?
answer: I went to the wrestling, wanted to see that Amazing Spider-Man, but he didn't show up.

question: Listen, Harry something terrible happened.
answer: What? What?

question: My Planetary Conjunction papers... they were stolen...
answer: Oh my God... Are you sure...? Who would do such a thing?

question: Ock...
answer: Of course... but why...?

question: We have to find out, sit down. I want to access Dr. Octavius' main program. I want to know about his experiments with the cyclotron. Can you do it?
answer: I can try. I could access the system in the dorm. Okay. And through that I could crack the main line.

question: Alright. Now if we can just disrupt the Octavius file...
answer: Okay, let's try.

question: Got something!
answer: What is it?

question: Let me see. It's some kind of countdown clock.
answer: Countdown to what?

question: I don't know, but whatever it is, it's only six hours away.
answer: The Planetary Conjunction?

question: Could be...
answer: Or Doc Ock's end of the world experiment... Or both!

question: Wait a minute. You're not telling me you think the world is gonna end tonight...?
answer: You want to wait around till midnight to find out?

question: No, but...
answer: Let's see what else we've got.

question: What's that?
answer: It might be a calculation of the amount of power he needs to create the hole between the force and the anti-force.

question: That's a lot of energy. What could generate power like that?
answer: The closest you could come is the New York City Subway System.

question: Oh my God!
answer: The THROB and PULSE recede. SCREAMS, HONKS, SIRENS can be heard.

question: Henry!!! What are you doing here? Get out of here! Get out of here!
answer: A CROWD has gathered to gawk and point. They look up and we see their POV. The CROWD sees something else. Swinging high in the sky is your friendly neighborhood SPIDER-MAN. The COUPLE and TWO DRIVERS argue about what this means.

question: Okay, folks, just hang on... Okay, one at a time. You first, Ma'am...
answer: This is Doctor Otto Octavius' work. I must get back to my university. I must stop Ock... he's gone crazy. Can you help me?

question: Sure thing, just don't take the train. Come on... give me your hand.
answer: Spider-Man! Listen to me! If he can do this with the train, if he's come this far, then I can pretty well predict his next step. He'll go to Plutonium SL 270 for the power. He must be stopped... or else he'll destroy our world.

question: Let's get you out of here first, Professor.
answer: Wait Spider-Man. I don't think I can make it... You mustn't waste time saving me... you must save the world! You must go and stop Ock!

question: Where can I find him...?
answer: He is looking for Plutonium SL 270 I'm sure...

question: Think Rosomorf, think where one can find Plutonium? Where could he find SL 270...?
answer: There's only one place he can get the Plutonium SL 270...

question: Where...?
answer: Toxic... toxic dump... any toxic dump would have SL 270.

question: You're as lovely as Peter said you were.
answer: Thank you. He really wanted so badly to come see you. He called me up out of the blue.

question: Tell me about Peter. What's he been up to? He seems so preoccupied.
answer: Oh, you know Peter... he's all caught up in some kind of study he's doing. Things are really crazy at the university now. Things are crazy... everywhere. I guess Peter's just... well, you know... pulled into his shell.

question: When Peter was little, he loved to hide. In the closets. Under the sink. He always needed a secret place. But when I'd look for him, he'd always laugh... he wanted to be found.
answer: Yeah... well. I don't think he wants me to find him... Well, I'd better be going. My friend Flash is picking me up.

question: This Flash... he isn't your boyfriend, is he?
answer: No... not really... I think you can guess why...

question: Elizabeth...? She turns. Finders keepers, losers weepers.
answer: What?

question: Got to find Ock... got to find the toxic dumps. Oh! Oh! Oh... yeah! What's up, Ock?
answer: You!!! You're a doomed bug, Wall Crawler. I've no time to waste on you now.

question: Hey, you big OCK, why don't you pick on someone your own size?!
answer: Alright Spider-Bug... here I've come for you...

question: Hey, driver. Could you follow that red Vette for me? Flash Thompson... I never thought I'd be happy to see you. Sorry about that!
answer: Spider-man! This is unbelievable...!

question: Flash, I need your help.
answer: You got it.

question: You any good with this thing?
answer: I'm the best.

question: Okay... catch that Vette!
answer: Roger, wilco, over and out. Why is he going to New Jersey, and who is it in that shitty red car...

question: New Jersey has the largest toxic waste dump in the world.
answer: What does he want with toxic waste?

question: He's looking for Plutonium, my dear... The car has to slow down... it's in a traffic jam.
answer: Sorry... can't do anything about this traffic.

question: Try to stay with me. I don't want to lose him! Bingo.
answer: Okey, dokey...

question: Open that now, and you'll spoil Christmas.
answer: Insect! I am going to squash you to death... Once I lay my Waldos on your skinny bones... Goodbye, Spider-Man!

question: Noooooooooooooo! Okay now, Spidey. Easy does it. Don't give up, Spidey. Don't give up. Empty... now what do I do?
answer: So you've avoided the nuclear pool, have you, Spider-Man?

question: Well, so far so good. But I can't hold on much longer.
answer: Pity...!

question: Oh, come on, Ock, be a good sport. Let's talk this over face to face... throw me a line...
answer: Okay... face to face... Catch this!

question: Leave them alone Otto!
answer: But, they won't help me. Everybody is trying to destroy my experiment. And so are you, Rosomorf.

question: Otto... I was wrong. I've gone over your research. It's brilliant, Otto. It's mad, but it's brilliant. You have much work left to do. I want to help you, Otto. For the sake of science, go and do your experiment. Leave... these kids alone and I'll help you.
answer: You will? You too? Help me with these drums, I need to get them to my laboratory immediately.

question: Do as he says.
answer: Drive, Flash, before I flush your girl right down the toilet!

question: Peter, where are you?
answer: Listen, Harry. You must get my paper before Ock uses it...

question: Your Planetary Conjunction data? It's too late... Ock's got your paper, it's in his computer already. But don't worry... he can never use it without Plutonium.
answer: He's got the Plutonium, and he's on his way back to the lab! And he's got two prisoners with him... Liz and Flash!

question: Don't worry... he needs a huge amount of power... thousands of volts of electricity... to get to the Anti-Force.
answer: He can get to the power. Electrical power... to the max. Nuclear power... SL 270. And now, at the moment of full Planetary Conjunction. When all the planets line up with the sun... maximum gravitational power. The Conjunction is Ock's final power source.

question: How much time is left? Wait... I can find out... my God... 59 minutes!
answer: The only way we can interfere with Ock's plan is to find a computer center... fast.

question: Our University has the biggest center in town.
answer: Yeah, but who's gonna work 'em?

question: I think I can get some help... I can teach anyone how to work a code in five minutes.
answer: Then do it!

question: A goddamn water leak...
answer: Hey, look at this. Empire State University. This is our cyclotron, right?

question: What does it say?
answer: It says "no information on net."

question: Maybe there's another way...
answer: It's breaking apart!

question: Alright, keep moving, a step at a time!
answer: We have to go back.

question: We can't go back.
answer: Forget it...

question: Okay, have it your way.
answer: What am I supposed to do with this!

question: Go ahead. It's easier than it looks! We've got to try the fire escape.
answer: The door is stuck.
